required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Between ThinSeed™ and OncoSeed™ for Permanent Prostate Brachytherapy
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Health Related Quality of Life and Other Clinical Parameters Between ThinSeed™ and OncoSeed™ for Permanent Low Dose Rate Implantation in Localized Prostate Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: This study will investigate health related quality of life factors in patients undergoing low dose rate prostate brachytherapy. Patients will be randomized to Iodine-125 Thinstrand (for use with 20 g needles) or Rapidstrand (for use with standard 18 g needles). Urinary, bowel, sexual function and bother will be measured by the EPIC questionnaire at various time intervals.

primary_outcome.measure: Health related quality of life including urinary, bowel and sexual function as measured by the EPIC questionnaire

intervention.intervention_name: RapidStrand seeds for use with 18g needle
intervention.description: Rapidstrand seeds are standard size and are used with 20 g needles
intervention.other_name: Both Rapidstrand and Thinstrand are manufactured by Oncura

intervention.description: ThinStrand seeds are smaller in diameter and used with 20g needles
intervention.other_name: Both ThinStrand and RapidStrand are manufactured by Oncura.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Histologically confirmed adenocarcinoma of the prostate, clinical stage T1c - T2b, N0, M0
- Greater than or equal to 40 years of age
- Low and Low- Intermediate Risk prostate cancer
- Prostate volumes by TRUS ≤ 60 cc
- I-PSS score < 25 (alpha blockers allowed)
- Signed study-specific informed consent form prior to study entry
Exclusion Criteria:
- Lymph node involvement (N1)
- Evidence of distant metastases (M1)
- Radical surgery for carcinoma of the prostate
- Prior pelvic radiation
- Major medical or psychiatric illness, which in the investigator's opinion would prevent completion of treatment and would interfere with follow- up or ability to complete questionnaires
- Hip prosthesis
- Inability or refusal to provide informed consent
- Evidence of Previous TURP
- Prior hormone therapy
- Prior TURP
